Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 01:28PM bygrace17 wrote: I've had 3 complex cysts and all have been biopsied.  They didn't say much about the apocrine other than not to worry as it's common and usually incidental.  I see the breast surgeon every 3 months and have a follow up in July.  Fibrocystic pain can really stink, and I know a lot of women have had success with cutting down on caffeine and taking evening primrose oil capsules which are over the counter.  (actually had a breast pain specialist tell me to try this several years ago.  He's located in the breast cancer center in a large university)  So you may try it to see if it helps.  Trust me, I am as frustrated with all of this as you are.  I've actually read into nipple sparing mastectomy and have thought about pursuing it to be done with all this.  I'm not sure how many more times I can or want to endure this process.  Not to mention the mental anguish that goes along with it.  I'm not sure if anone around here does it and not sure if my insurance would even cover it but I'm going to ask about it when I go for my appointment.  You are also at a greater risk having a mom with BC as you know.    {{{{hugs sister}}}} hang in there:  I'll keep you in my prayers!!
Posts.Title: Breast Pain with lumps floridian floridian

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2009 09:16PM bygrace17 wrote: Hi Floridian: YES fibrous tissue hurts!  I also have multiple lumps, cysts, inflamed ducts, apocrine metaplasia, undiagnosed lumps, foam cells, etc etc etc...  I am BIRADS 4.  I've had cyclical pain for years that has often been moderate to severe and have tried many things to alleviate that pain.  I've learned to "deal" with it.  I'm not on the pill as you mentioned but I do experience it with my cycle every time even when my cycle hits after only two weeks.  My biopsies have been benign so far!  I've had extremely large cysts drained that are also painful when full/filling.  I have not had an MRI because I was told that insurance often denies them and that they often show false positives so my Dr. did not want to order it.  I do have mammo's and sono's bilaterally every time I go. Sorry you are dealing with this too!  HUG!

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2009 12:33PM bygrace17 wrote: to Waynab and all the other gals here please know I am praying for all of us.   I believe in God, and believe there's a reason we are all here, benign or not!  I'm not thrusting my faith at anyone, by any means, and I fully respect the rights of each individual to believe what they want, but I would like to share with you... something I believe, as a Christ follower:  "Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.  Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.  For my yoke is easy and my burden is light" For my own sanity: I have to go here.  I'm not one to speak because I totally fall short of this.  I am "waiting" right now as well.  I have a good feeling that the no news is good news for me.  Remember gals: find something positive to focus on..it's healthier! Please feel free to send me private messages as well..  I'm not the best but I'll certainly try!   love and hugs to all!!!
Posts.Title: Scared, really scared waynab waynab

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2009 03:11PM bygrace17 wrote: Hi Waynab, Please don't stress yet.  I know it's hard not to, because I am guilty of the same thing.  Sometimes calcifications can be just calcium deposits and nothing more.  Lumps are benign 80% of the time.  There are many reason for both.  I can't begin to count my lumps and the ones that have been biopsied have been benign.  I'm waiting now for more results as well.  Stay positive.  It's not anything until the pathologist decides it is something...    The gals here have been fabulous support!

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 12:37PM bygrace17 wrote: Yes it could be nothing but just the same it could be something.  It's not unreasonable to ask for referral to a breast specialist.  You didn't mention if you had a mammo (you need digital diagnostic)  or MRI (being young you may have denser tissue).  Remember most lumps are benign lumps so try not to stress about it too much.  Keep us posted!  Take a deep breath and EXHALE!  Here's a {{{{{{{HUG}}}}}}}
Posts.Title: Tired of waiting.... msaylor Beesie

Posts.Content: May 2, 2009 06:01PM bygrace17 wrote: TFrye, Please know you are NEVER alone in this!  I am sorry you must deal with another BX and waiting all over again.  The waiting is so hard.  I'm the type who says just tell me so we can move forward. It is not odd to ask for your BIRAD score as it is not odd to ask for copies of your radiology reports.  I encourage everyone to know first hand what they say.  You are your best advocate and the only way to do that well is to educate yourself with the correct information.  You are entitled to copies of any part of your medical record including all imaging.  It's YOURS. We're here with you.  We're in this together.  We may all be at different stages but we all share common ground, that being: BREASTS.  It doesn't matter if we are young, old, male or female! Here's {{{{HUGS}}}} for you!  Hang in there.    Will be praying for you...  PHIL 4:13~

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2009 12:25AM bygrace17 wrote: Take all of your test results along with the reports to a breast specialist to look at and to examine you...  It's worth it to have a second opinion.  Around here lumps are said to be better off in a jar even though 80% are benign.  Obviously they were concerned or you would not have gone through all that testing.   Good luck to you and keep us posted please.  :)

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2009 11:18PM bygrace17 wrote: very, take a deep breath.  nothing is anything until there is a pathology report.  I always have to have sonograms after my mammograms because of questionable findings.  I've had 3 biopsies all 3 B9.  Get some rest, love on your baby and wait until you know more.  I'll be saying prayers for you.  Please keep us posted!  {{{{{{{HUGE HUG}}}}}}}

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2009 11:16PM bygrace17 wrote: hiking: sorry about your wait.  Yes, unfortunately they sometimes take this long to get back with you.  It's VERY frustrating to have to do the wait/worry thing.  Call your Dr. on Monday and ask about it, and like Idaho said, stop by and pick up a copy of your report.  Praying for B9 for you!!
Posts.Title: Waiting hiking bbell41

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 09:09AM bygrace17 wrote: Tink welcome.  Sorry you are having to go through this right now.  Take a deep breath.  80% of lumps that are biopsied are benign so odds are in your favor at this point.  I am also BIRADS 4 and all of my biopsies have been benign.  BIRADS is the ranking scale that radiologists use to score the results of the findings.  You can google it to read more on it.  If you are really stressed about the biopsy ask your Dr. to call in something like a xanax to take ahead of time to relax you.  They will numb the area and do the biopsy.  if you feel it then SAY something so they can numb it more.  You will be asked to use ice packs after and  I strongly suggest you be VERY liberal with them and use them around the clock.  They will give you one that fits right into your bra relax with a bag of frozen peas when you get home.   If you have a sport bra without wires wear it for a few days after.  Sometimes they will wrap you snuggly in ace bandage so you wouldn't need the bra and either is fine. (I've had them do both) The rest is the waiting that takes FOREVER and a day after (at least it feels like that but typically 3-5 business days in the US) please keep us posted and I'll be praying for you!!!  {{{{{{{HUGS}}}}}}} GRACE~  phil4:13
Posts.Title: New, and have SO many questions. Tink512 Tink512

Posts.Content: May 2, 2009 11:17PM bygrace17 wrote: I also have fibrocystic breasts and have had cyclical pain for years.  I have also had areas of increased focal pain (non cyclical) that required biopsy.  Those areas still exist and have huge cysts surrounding them.  (larger than golf balls)  The skin on the surface above these areas has also thickened.  I have often wondered if something is being "missed" in this area but have been refused MRI.  Mammo isn't great because of both density and multiple cysts so I have US too.  ATLgigi: so glad you got B9! AMERON: when are your tests?  keep us posted. Thanks to everyone for sharing your experiences.  It's been of great benefit to me personally.  {{{HUGS}}}

Posts.Content: May 11, 2009 06:42PM bygrace17 wrote: Kassie, I had a large cyst aspirated and could feel another lump beneath it as well that turned out to be another cyst.  I, like barbe, had a large cyst aspirated that actually refilled during the procedure to aspirate it.  (it was done under sono so you could visualize the filling).  I've also had it biopsied (which was benign).   My nipple also "pulls" in on thay side especially when I raise my arm.  That area is quite painful but it is also under the nipple in the areola region which is a very sensitive area to have something pressing against.  It's never wrong to get a second opinion....  Good luck to you!  Please keep us posted, we'll be praying!

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2009 06:28PM bygrace17 wrote: saint melissa, I totally understand what you mean.  I have a new "hard spot" that I'm having checked soon and feeling a bit alone and freaked out too.  It feels like no one around me really gets it.  I had a dilated duct removed that was also BIRADS4 and it was benign.  I'm hoping this is too, and I shouldn't worry about it but sometimes I can't help it.  I find myself feeling it several times a day to see if it goes away but it doesn't.  I know both my mother in law and a  colleague of mine had calcifications removed and they were also benign.  (I've also seen them that weren't) so... yes, I fret a bit when I find something new.   I noticed you're a prayer.  I am too.  I've seen breast cancer take two of my girl friends and I've seen two beat it so I know it can be done.  I, too, felt silly posting here with all of the gals who have so much more to worry and deal with than my little possibly benign possibly not issues.  I am also lifting them up in prayers!  Now I'm lifting you up too!   let's pray for benign again!!  Phil 4:13

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2009 06:02PM bygrace17 wrote: Thanks momo3esb!  I go Monday for more "needles" in the newest lump.  Feeling nauseated about it.  I have an 18yr old daughter who has a lump we had sono in Dec and was told it's a fibroadenoma.  They read the report to me sounded quite confident it looked "normal".  She just went to the gynos office not the breast center where I go.  I didn't push for the BX but wonder if I should have.  I'm not sure she'd go for it anyway.  She had initially complained of it hurting but says it's ok now so I'm thinking maybe cyclical.  I hate that I passed on my 'lumpiness".  I worry with her more though because my husbands family has serious breast cancer.  (every aunt and grandmother had/has it)  I'm not sure how much genetic comes from the paternal side but I think about it anyhow.  Thanks for easing my mind about the posts.   I realize I'm sounding negative again and don't want to...I know: most lumps are benign... I need to stay focused there and not fret that I have something "hiding" behind one of mine.  It's great to have you "listen" to.  :)  Thanks so much!!  really...  :)
Posts.Title: Worried and felling alone saintmelissa saintmelissa

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2009 02:40AM bygrace17 wrote: Thanks ladies for the info!  I'm glad I brought that up about my daughter.  I didn't realize the paternal gene was as equally prominent as the maternal gene!  Double arg!  Even though I am educated I seem to be so lost here.  I need to do more homework!  I talk to my girls about BSE's all the time.   I've been very open about my lumps and the treatments.  They had lot's of questions about my VAB and wanted to see so I showed them all during the healing process. (had lots of bruising for several weeks)  I will make sure they are educated enough to watch themselves for sure!  They've seen what cancer can do so I hope they will remember to be diligent.  I'm praying for you gals!  Thanks for being my support, my cyber friends, and my educators!  I will stay in touch.  I'm hoping for benign again this week.  :)
